content: ginnie s winter bandana © sandra levey 2023 a simple winter bandana sized for my 30kg 65lb greyhound but easily altered to fit dogs of many sizes please note that sighthounds have a slim head compared to neck size and this will have a bearing on using this pattern for other breeds as this is worked to suit the neck size you can choose to work a different weight of yarn tiny dogs would be more suited to lace weight or fingering weight yarn with appropriate-sized needles this pattern is used by me to make bandanas for donating to gear4greys an australian-based online store for greyhound gear and as such i ask that you do not sell items made from this pattern unless you are donating the full proceeds directly to dog rescue groups if you wish to knit and donate the item directly to a rescue group then i commend your efforts and encourage you to do so thank you for being an excellent human *disclaimer please be sensible using any object around your dogs neck i will not be held responsible for any injury caused please feel free to make any alterations necessary to suit your needs but know that i am unable to assist you size written to fit a medium greyhound with a 42cm neck yarn colour 1 50 metres dk weight multi-coloured or gradient colour 2 70 metres dk weight plain coloured yarn that works well with c1 gauge 20 sts and 34 row to 10cm 4 - measured over the pattern don t be too fussed though as you re aiming for warmth and drape needles 4 0mm 60cm 24 circular needle to accommodate stitch count or long straight needles note that this entire project is worked flat and if choosing to work on straight needles you may find that needles shorter than 30cm 12 may struggle as the stitch count increases and the shape changes notions one stitch marker measuring tape tapestry needle for weaving in ends skills required work kfb increases work basic striping colourwork abbreviations c1 colour 1 c2 colour 2 kfb knit front & back a single increase k knit p purl pm place marker sm slip marker simply slip the marker on ws row where it isn t mentioned pattern this bandana is worked from the top down ie the ears commencing with a small cast-on after the initial set-up you will continue alternating between c1 and c2 every two row before using only c2 for the border prior to binding off three row out of every four are worked as predominantly knit row with a fourth being predominantly purl 1 ginnie s winter bandana ©sandra levey 15 january 2023 my measurements are in metric with approximate equivalent given in imperial don t be too fussed i m sure your dog won t be bothered please read the entire pattern prior to commencing cast on and setup row using c1 cast on 13 stitches when changing colours do not
